natural solution: To start, find a common denominator on the left side. The lowest common multiple of 7 and 3 is 21, so this is the common denominator. Rewrite the equation as: \begin{align} \frac{3x}{21}+\frac{7x}{21} &= 1 - x \\
\frac{10x}{21} &= 1 - x \\ \end{align}We now multiply both sides by $21$ to get $10x = 21 - 21x,$ then $31x = 21.$ So $x = \boxed{\frac{21}{31}}.$
